cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, re-strengthen into a tropical storm, then turn north and come ashore along the northern Gulf Coast before moving inland through Alabama/Tennessee toward the Ohio Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Florida Panhandle or southeast Alabama

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Mississippi to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds below tropical-storm force (likely <25–30 mph) possible mid-week as remnants pass south/east of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture may bring 1–3 inches of rain to northwest Ohio mid-week, causing brief ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized flooding of low-lying areas; otherwise minimal operational impacts expected
